channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Medical residents are starting to avoid states with abortion bans, data shows
item.description: A new analysis shows that students graduating from U.S. medical schools were less likely to apply this year for residencies across specialties in states with restrictions on abortion.
item.content:encoded:
A new analysis shows that students graduating from U.S. medical schools were less likely to apply this year for residencies across specialties in states with restrictions on abortion.

(Image credit: Jeff Gritchen)
item.dc:creator: Julie Rovner

item.title: Biden warns he'll halt Israel weapons shipments; the Kendrick and Drake beef explained
item.description: Biden says he will halt additional weapons shipments to Israel if it proceeds with a major ground offensive in Rafah. NPR music editor Sheldon Pearce breaks down the Kendrick Lamar/Drake beef.
item.content:encoded:
Biden says he will halt additional weapons shipments to Israel if it proceeds with a major ground offensive in Rafah. NPR music editor Sheldon Pearce breaks down the Kendrick Lamar/Drake beef.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Migrant crime is politically charged, but the reality is more complicated
item.description: Republicans have raised the alarm about a migrant crime wave. Nationally, crime is down even as immigration has surged, but the concerns are real in some neighborhoods.
item.content:encoded:
Republicans have raised the alarm about a migrant crime wave. Nationally, crime is down even as immigration has surged, but the concerns are real in some neighborhoods.

(Image credit: Martin Kaste)
item.dc:creator: Martin Kaste

item.title: The judge and the prosecutor in the Georgia Trump case are running for reelection too
item.description: The judge overseeing Donald Trump's Georgia election interference case is running for reelection this month. So is the case's top prosecutor. It's a unique subplot to an unprecedented case.
item.content:encoded: The judge overseeing Donald Trump's Georgia election interference case is running for reelection this month. So is the case's top prosecutor. It's a unique subplot to an unprecedented case.
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: A WWII story by The Twilight Zone's Rod Serling is published for the first time
item.description: Twilight Zone creator Rod Serling was a paratrooper during WWII. After the war, he wrote a short story inspired by the experience. It's now being published for the first time in The Strand.
item.content:encoded:
Twilight Zone creator Rod Serling was a paratrooper during WWII. After the war, he wrote a short story inspired by the experience. It's now being published for the first time in The Strand.

(Image credit: Esther Cooper Serling)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: For Mother's Day, a bouquet of useful health advice for new moms and moms-to-be
item.description: Expert guidance on the realities of pregnancy and new motherhood from Life Kit. Find episodes on the menstrual cycle, egg freezing, postpartum depression and more.
item.content:encoded: Expert guidance on the realities of pregnancy and new motherhood from Life Kit. Find episodes on the menstrual cycle, egg freezing, postpartum depression and more.
item.dc:creator: Life Kit

item.title: Tornadoes tear through the southeastern U.S. as storms leave 3 dead
item.description: Forecasters warned a wave of dangerous storms in the U.S. could march through parts of the South early Thursday, after deadly storms a day earlier spawned damaging tornadoes and massive hail.
item.content:encoded:
Forecasters warned a wave of dangerous storms in the U.S. could march through parts of the South early Thursday, after deadly storms a day earlier spawned damaging tornadoes and massive hail.

(Image credit: Marshall Gorby)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: FTX says it will return money to most of its customers
item.description: FTX says that nearly all of its customers will receive the money back that they are owed, two years after the cryptocurrency exchange imploded, and some will get more than that.
item.content:encoded:
FTX says that nearly all of its customers will receive the money back that they are owed, two years after the cryptocurrency exchange imploded, and some will get more than that.

(Image credit: Bruce Kluckhohn)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: ChatGPT maker OpenAI exploring how to 'responsibly' make AI erotica
item.description: The San Francisco-based AI juggernaut says it is re-evaluating its policies around "NSFW" content.
item.content:encoded:
The San Francisco-based AI juggernaut says it is re-evaluating its policies around "NSFW" content.

(Image credit: Richard Drew)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Biden says he would halt additional weapons shipments if Israel invades Rafah
item.description: The president's comments to CNN follow news that one shipment of bombs is already on hold out of concern about the impact on civilian lives.
item.content:encoded:
The president's comments to CNN follow news that one shipment of bombs is already on hold out of concern about the impact on civilian lives.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: NPR Washington Desk
